intro: Primula poissonii, commonly known as the Chinese primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and broad, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a vibrant touch to woodland gardens and shaded areas.
